title: Table of values of derivative, no context

content.question: x 2 3 5 8 13 f(x) 1 4 -2 3 6 Let f be a function that is twice differentiable for all real numbers. The table above gives values of f for selected points in the closed interval 2 ≤ x ≤ 13. (a) Estimate f′(4). Show the work that leads to your answer.

frqParts.text: x 2 3 5 8 13 f(x) 1 4 -2 3 6 Let f be a function that is twice differentiable for all real numbers. The table above gives values of f for selected points in the closed interval 2 ≤ x ≤ 13. (a) Estimate f′(4). Show the work that leads to your answer.

(b) Evaluate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mrow> <mn>13</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mn>5</mn> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@446B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.

(c) Use a left Riemann sum with subintervals indicated by the data in the table to approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mrow> <mn>13</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@404E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.

(d) Suppose f'(5) = 3 and f''(x) < 0 for all x in the closed interval 5 ≤ x ≤ 8. Use the line tangent to the graph of f at x = 5 to show that f(7) ≤ 4. Use the secant line for the graph of f on 5 ≤ x ≤ 8 to show that f(7) ≥ 4/3.

topic.text: 2.3: Estimating Derivatives of a Function at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
